intro: Stachytarpheta frantzii var. patentiflora, commonly known as the patentiflora bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while the plant is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant floral display. Stachytarpheta frantzii var. patentiflora thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil.
